BackEnd.Model

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • BackEnd.Model.Table
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssignmentTable, CourseTable, GradeTable, StudentEnrollmentTable, SubmissionTable, UserTable

    public abstract class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class has methods to perform operations common to all mySQL tables. Methods that are very similar for all table are concrete and ones that are more unique are abstract.
    Since:
    2018-03-30
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Antoine Bizon, Ross Bartlett

      The statement executor object used to access the database.

      The name of the table.

      • addToDB

        public abstract <T extends java.io.Serializable> java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> addToDB(T addition)
        Adds a new row to a table in the database given an object of they type in the table.
        Parameters:
        addition - the object being added to a row.
        Returns:
        The number of rows affected by the update, i.e. if the object was added.

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> editRow(java.lang.String param,
                                                      java.lang.String key,
                                                      java.lang.String condition,
                                                      java.lang.String conditionVal)
        Updates the table with specified values and conditions.
        Parameters:
        param - the parameter to be updated.
        key - the new value of the parameter.
        condition - the column to be checked for the condition.
        conditionVal - the value of the condition.
        Returns:
        the number of affected rows.
